image.altText: A sign reading Darwin Waterfront

props.synopsis: The Darwin Waterfront Corporation has been cleared of wrongdoing by a Northern Territory parliamentary committee, after the Territory Labor leader raised misuse of public money allegations.

title.children: Claims of made-up NT public job cleared by parliamentary committee

image.altText: A close-up of a man with white hair and glasses looking directly into the camera with a wall behind him

props.synopsis: A man who had "formal" and "informal" arrangements with South Australia's Department for Child Protection to house First Nations children has pleaded not guilty to more than 40 charges including sexual offending against minors.

title.children: Man who worked with SA's child protection department pleads not guilty to child sex offences

image.altText: Aboriginal man, gray hair, in a button up shirt sitting in front of a sign that reads 'Blak Lives Matter' on an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: The grandfather of a 24-year-old Aboriginal man who died in police custody in Alice Springs last week has renewed his demands for CCTV vision and an independent probe into the death.

title.children: 'We do not trust police': Continued calls for CCTV in death in custody probe

image.altText: An architectural design shows a terracotta-coloured art gallery standing on a green lawn.

props.synopsis: The long-standing chair of the Museum and Art Gallery of the NT has quit her position, just weeks after an announcement that a planned $150 million Darwin CBD art gallery may not be going ahead.

title.children: Government labels NT art gallery fallout 'a shemozzle' as chair resigns

image.altText: A black plastic bag full of cannabis

props.synopsis: Police say a drug bust that netted 113kg of cannabis and $170,000 in cash has disrupted a sophisticated, cross-border Vietnamese crime gang trafficking large quantities of illegal drugs into the Northern Territory.

title.children: Police say 113kg drug bust 'strikes at the heart' of Vietnamese crime gang

image.altText: An adult cane toad sitting on the ground.

props.synopsis: Milk squeezed from the glands of cane toads could be key to controlling the invasive pests in Australia, with the toxic liquid being used to bait underwater traps.

title.children: How milking cane toad toxin is helping to control the invasive pests

image.altText: A thumbnail showing the moment tracer shots are fired outside the GHF aid centre

props.synopsis: Early Sunday morning, Palestinians desperate for aid were killed while approaching an aid distribution site. ABC NEWS Verify analysed security footage, satellite imagery, and videos from the ground to try and paint a clearer picture.

title.children: What we know about Sunday's deadly incident near aid centre in Gaza

image.altText: A middle aged white woman on a hospital bed with a machine over her mouth helping her breathe

props.synopsis: After years of lobbying from patients, the first ever national lung cancer screening program will roll out next month for people who have a significant history of smoking.

title.children: Australia's deadliest cancer to get new screening program

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: ASIC has accused the now-defunct Westpac brand of breaching its obligations under credit laws and engaging in "widespread unlicensed conduct" between June 2019 and April 2023.

title.children: Westpac's defunct bank RAMS sued over allegations of 'liar loan' mortgage applications

image.altText: An explosion coming from underwater with black smoke rising by  a bridge structure.

props.synopsis: Ukraine uses 1,100 kilograms of underwater explosives to attack the Kerch Bridge, which is a key supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine.

title.children: Ukraine hits bridge linking Russia and Crimea with underwater explosives

image.altText: A woman with sort hair is composited behind two men wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A recent US report on an abortion pill which experts have called "misinformation", "not scientific" and "scaremongering" has been cited in NSW Parliament by no less than 11 MPs across the spectrum.

title.children: 'Completely worthless': Flawed abortion pill 'study' cited in parliament

image.altText: A picture of four apples and a banana

props.synopsis: Hundreds of pages of secret documents leaked to the ABC provide a rare glimpse into how human censors and AI erase references to Beijing's violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in 1989.

title.children: Why a picture of 'one banana and four apples' could be censored in China

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: Federal agents are investigating "to what extent" Mohamed Sabry Soliman's family knew about the attack, and if they provided any support.

title.children: Colorado fire-bomb suspect's family being held for deportation

image.altText: Ed Husic gestures while speaking in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: In the wake of a huge victory few saw coming, Labor's enormous majority comes with a downside for the prime minister.

title.children: Labor's big numbers leave enough room for defectors and disagreements

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka playing at the French Open.

props.synopsis: Playing in front of a half-empty stadium in the morning leaves world number one Aryna Sabalenka questioning the scheduling of women's matches at the French Open.

title.children: Sabalenka wants 'equal treatment' over scheduling of French Open women's matches

image.altText: A man in a suit holds up both arms while giving a thumbs up on stage.

props.synopsis: The election comes after six months of turmoil sparked by a shock martial law briefly imposed by former leader Yoon Suk Yeol.

title.children: Liberal Lee Jae-myung wins South Korea's snap presidential election

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks have opened higher after Wall Street gained. Economic growth slowed more than forecast in the first quarter of the year. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX maintains gains as GDP misses forecasts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA may opt to cut rates in July
Economic growth slowed by reduced public spending

image.altText: GettyImages-2178168387

props.synopsis: GWS was surprised this year's AFLW fixture would feature no double-headers after being one of the "strong advocates" for the initiative.

title.children: AFLW players worry lack of double-header games may lead to split crowd

image.altText: Pink and green the aurora australis at Razorback Lookout in Victoria

props.synopsis: We've been treated to some stunning aurora australis light displays over the past few days. But the solar cycle means that'll settle down soon.

title.children: Why the aurora australis boom we're enjoying won't last forever

image.altText: Dry, cracked ground on a farm.

props.synopsis: There are multiple signs a boost in rainfall this winter and spring will alleviate the record drought currently crippling southern Australia.

title.children: Hope on the horizon — five reasons the drought will ease this year

image.altText: Alex Mills and two other men sitting near each other talking and smiling.

props.synopsis: Alex Mills has battled with stereotypes of what a man should be for years. He's now shedding light on toxic masculinity in a bid to get more men to think about the type of man they want to be and stamp out certain behaviours.

title.children: It's taken Alex decades to feel comfortable with the kind of man he is

image.altText: A close

props.synopsis: Four years after fleeing Hong Kong, outspoken pro-democracy advocate Ted Hui continues to be the target of an intimidation campaign, which the SA Law Society has denounced.

title.children: Pro-democracy activist targeted in 'deeply concerning' intimidation campaign

image.altText: A young woman with blond hair and glasses looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Fwends is a uniquely Australian story that follows two 20-somethings who travel interstate to revive their long-distance friendship.

title.children: This Aussie film about female friendship is taking the world by storm

image.altText: Two white parrots with yellow crests stand on a waist-high fence waiting for another to stop drinking from a fountain.

props.synopsis: The behaviour has spread among a mob of more than 100 sulphur-crested cockatoos that roost in the Western Sydney Parklands.

title.children: Clever cockies not only open bins, they can use water fountains too

image.altText: Adam Ballard standing with a big hat on holding a golden trophy surrounded by people.

props.synopsis: Adam is a local celebrity, but his 67-year-old parents are planning for when they're no longer around to care for him — and it means a 700km move.

title.children: Adam's a star in his home town, but tough choices are on the horizon

image.altText: A man and woman wearing a mask, sitting on a park bench with distance between them

props.synopsis: What has changed since the pandemic when it comes to isolating when sick, whether it's COVID or a bad cold?

title.children: Should you still isolate when you are sick with COVID or influenza?

image.altText: Top of 1 William Street building in Brisbane CBD, taken from South Bank with bougainvillea flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Queensland has received nearly $3 million from unclaimed estates in recent years. Experts say outdated inheritance laws are partly to blame.

title.children: Millions in deceased estates transferred to Queensland government

image.altText: Cortnee Nine dribbles the ball for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: New Matildas coach Joe Montemurro will start contacting players ahead of his first matches in charge, including one of the faces of the 2023 Women's World Cup.

title.children: World Cup hero 'on the radar' for Matildas recall

image.altText: A marble statue of a man with half of the face missing.

props.synopsis: Every state eventually disappears. Is there a way they can last longer?

title.children: All societies come to an end. Sometimes it's messier than others

image.altText: Katrine hildyard in a blazer speaking into microphones in front of a large painting

props.synopsis: The bill passed in the upper house during a late-night sitting on Tuesday, after securing enough support from the state's crossbench.

title.children: New SA child protection laws pass but advocates say reforms don't go far enough

image.altText: A scruffy dog with wide eyes and patchy coloured fur peaks out to the camera in between a picket fence.

props.synopsis: The government has cancelled a contract with software provider Seisma to develop a statewide digital pet registration portal, a key move in its fight against puppy farming.

title.children: WA quietly scraps $9.8m contract for anti-puppy-farming program

image.altText: A man arrested near a police van during raids over drugs and illegal tobacco

props.synopsis: Police allege the audacious plan to smuggle almost half a tonne of drugs and 20 million illegal cigarettes was masterminded by a cleanskin western Sydney man with no criminal record.

title.children: 'It's fake': How police busted illegal tobacco, drugs ring

image.altText: A twirl of cloud funnels up towards a big, dark cloud band above a line of trees.

props.synopsis: A farmer is stunned as he assesses the damage from a tornado that formed during a storm near Frankland River.

title.children: Tornado flips car as storms sweep across southern WA

image.altText: A man in a green singlet shears a sheep in a dark shed.

props.synopsis: Homeschooled and growing up on a farm, Ellie Morris hopes photography skills honed since she was a child will help people see the beauty rural Australia has to offer.

title.children: Photos of rural life go global for WA farmhand
